newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - Mar 12.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - Mar 12.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following stories on its front page on Wednesday:

* The U.S. Senate voted for a much broader investigation into White House and Congressional campaign fund-raising abuses after Republican leaders relinquished their demands for a probe of only illegal activities.
* Jordan's King Hussein sent Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu a scathing letter in which he accused Netanyahu of trying to destroy efforts to achieve peace in the Middle East.

* Anthony Lake, President Clinton's nominee to head the Central Intelligence Agency, sat through a tense Senate confirmation hearing in which he said he was not warned of possible efforts by China to influence U.S. elections through campaign contributions.

* A poll shows New York City residents are more optimistic about the city's crime-fighting efforts and its economy, but it also shows these opinions are divided along racial, ethnic and economic lines.
* President Clinton recommended that television broadcasters give away free air time to political candidates in exchange for new licenses to provide digital high-definition television.

* Strict new codes adopted by school officials seeking to cut violence and drugs in the classroom are sparking debate as mandatory punishment guidelines included in these rules ensnare innocent students.
* Peru's government is debating how best to reform a law exonerating a rapist if he offers to marry his victim and she accepts.
